item.title: Borderlands 4: All Safehouses, Data Pads, and Console Locations
item.description:
Outside of the main story for Borderlands 4 , there are 12 Safehouses that players can discover. Each Safehouse has its own Datapad and Console that are required to activate it, thus providing players with a safe haven and a new HUB where they can purchase items, rest up, and select new contracts. Safehouses are essential for getting around Kairos, as each of them becomes a Fast Travel Station to use. Below, we've listed the location of every Safehouse in Borderlands 4 , along with where you can find the Datapad and Console to make these places a new home in Kairos.

Shut-Eye Keep Safehouse & Datapad Location

How to Get the Shut-Eye Keep Safehouse

  • Location: The Howl, The Fadefields

At Shut-Eye Keep, players will want to head right of the Safehouse to find an Order station, where they will be able to activate a lever that takes them upwards into the Safehouse itself. Follow the linear path through the garden area and into the Safehouse, then face the left side of the north wall and look up. Players will be able to find a grapple hook point, where they can then grapple up and find the Datapad. With the Datapad, head to the Command Console at the south wall to activate this Safehouse.

Someday Rise Safehouse & Datapad Location

How to Get the Someday Rise Safehouse

  • Location: Idolator's Noose, The Fadefields

Follow around Someday Rise to find a mountainside path, where players can climb up a ledge and grapple across to navigate to this Safehouse on the cliff. There are some hostile Manglers here, so be cautious of those. Opposite the Safehouse and to the left is a small campsite with the Datapad on a mattress. Grab the Datapad, head back to the Safehouse (which is now unlocked), and activate the Command Console at the north wall.

Wyclef's Reprieve Safehouse & Datapad Location

​​​​​​​How to Get the Wyclef's Reprieve Safehouse

  • Location: Idolator's Noose, The Fadefields

Once at Wyclef's Reprieve, the door should simply open for you (if it doesn't, just go around the bend to the left and follow the path down). Enter through Wyclef's Reprieve and jump down to a cliffside ​​​​​​​that has a crashed moon rock. On a metal box by this crashed moon rock is the Datapad, and now players can follow the path back up to Wyclef's Reprieve by following the east path to activate the Command Console found on the south wall of the Safehouse.

Grey Havenage Safehouse & Datapad Location

​​​​​​​How to Get the Grey Havenage Safehouse

  • Location: Cuspid Climb, Terminus Range

​​​​​​​Once you're at Grey Havenage, look to the southwest side to see a platform that can be grappled up to. From up this high platform, you can use the jetpack to glide across to a middle platform, and then boost again to reach a climbable surface. Once you've climbed to the top, you can grab the Datapad and use the ramp to the north of the Datapad to glide over to the Grey Havenage Safehouse. Inside the now-open Safehouse is the Command Console.

Heritage Opus Safehouse & Datapad Location

​​​​​​​How to Get the Heritage Opus Safehouse

  • Location: Cuspid Climb, Terminus Range

At Heritage Outpost, players will need to loop to the right to find a wall that they can climb, and then take an immediate left to follow the area around and fight through the Order forces. Players can keep climbing this spiral Safehouse with a grapple hook, where they will eventually face a bell tower. Just before the bell tower is some boxes that players can stand on to then double jump and glide to the bell tower roof to grab the Datapad. Now, the building to the left of the bell tower will be open, and players can walk up the stairs to claim the Command Console.

​​​​​​​

The Nightcap Safehouse & Datapad Location

​​​​​​​How to Get the Nightcap Safehouse

  • Location: Windspear, Terminus Range

The Nightcap can be located within a large crevice inside the mountain's opening, and once inside, players can jump up to a platform, where on the right is a wall that they can climb. Climb to the top of this wall and jump with a glide from the jetpack to reach another platform that contains the Datapad. This opens up the Safehouse, where players can enter and claim the Command Console. ​​​​​​​

Snowy Wells Safehouse & Datapad Location

​​​​​​​How to Get the Snowy Wells Keep Safehouse

  • Location: Stoneblood Forest, Terminus Range

Snowy Wells requires a bit of a climb, as players will want to look to the west side of this mountain range to grapple up. Continue following the path and using the grapple points provided to reach the locked Safehouse. Players can then grapple to the left of the main door and then grapple the water tower, where they can drop down and glide across to another building that has the Datapad. Simply glide back to the main doors of the Safehouse and follow the door around to the left to find the Command Console that's outside, which will open up the Safehouse for use.

​​​​​​​​​​​​​​

Makeshift Chalet Safehouse & Datapad Location

​​​​​​​How to Get the Makeshift Chalet Safehouse

  • Location: Lopside, Carcadia Burn

Once you reach the Makeshift Chalet, venture to the left side of the area to find a steep drop down the rocky cliffs, where, at the bottom, you'll find the Datapad. You can turn back around and grapple back up to the place you fell from. The Command Console is located at the southwest wall of Makeshift Chalet, just outside the Safehouse.

​​​​​​​

The Lowrise Safehouse & Datapad Location

​​​​​​​How to Get the Lowrise Safehouse

  • Location: Tonnage Peel, Carcadia Burn

Once players have made it to the Lowrise, they will want to use a grapple hook in the destroyed pipe to stand on top of it. From here, follow around to the right and use your grapple hook until you make it to the top of the rock. Once you're on the top, head north to locate the Datapad. With the Datapad acquired, head to the southwest side of the platform you are currently on to locate the Command Console to claim this land as a Safehouse.

​​​​​​​

Wildhorn's Beard Safehouse & Datapad Location

​​​​​​​How to Get the Wildhorn's Beard Safehouse

  • Location: Ruined Sumplands, Carcadia Burn

Once you've reached Wildhorn's Beard, you can loop behind the large rock and follow the stairs upwards to find a boat that contains the Datapad, along with a few deadly Kratch enemies. With the Datapad now acquired, head north of Wildhorn's Beard to find the Command Console within the central Safehouse area.

​​​​​​​

The Food Court Safehouse & Datapad Location

​​​​​​​How to Get the Food Court Safehouse

  • Location: Terminus District, Dominion City

Once players make it to the Terminus District of Dominion City, they will want to head left to The Food Court. In the northeast area of this place, there is a trash heap with a corpse and the Datapad that players seek. With your back to the trash heap, look to the right to find the Command Console, but beware of the Rippers that have claimed this area as a temporary home.

Sumpview Falls Safehouse & Datapad Location

​​​​​​​How to Get the Sumpview Falls Safehouse

  • Location: Fades District, Dominion City

The Fades District holds a Safehouse in the center of this region. Players will want to drop down to Sumpview Falls, where on the east wall is a ladder that can be climbed to discover the Datapad. With this Datapad acquired, turn around to the north to find the Command Console. Watch out for the Ripper and Order forces who are in the heat of battle here.

item.title: Assassin's Creed Unity Player Count is Way Up
item.description:
Assassin's Creed Unity is enjoying a significant player count spike on Steam at the moment, with numbers at their highest in years. The resurgence of Assassin's Creed Unity on the platform is almost certainly down to a particularly steep discount at the moment.

Assassin's Creed Unity was arguably a victim of its own ambition. Even for a 2014 title, it still looks visually excellent to this day, but this came at a cost of polish. Assassin's Creed Unity launched with tons of bugs, and it would quickly become known as one of the most disastrous video game launches of all time. It feels as though time has been kind to its reputation, and it's easier now to see how it attempted to bring Assassin's Creed to what was then the next generation of consoles.

Assassin's Creed Unity Player Count is At Its Highest in Years

Now, according to SteamDB, Assassin's Creed Unity is enjoying a much higher player count than usual on Steam. Its 24-hour peak sits at 4,522 at the time of writing, which is the highest number of players since September 2023. Notably, it's also the fourth-highest-peak player count that the game has ever achieved on Steam, with its initial launch 11 years ago being the pinnacle. This recent number even beats the slight bump it enjoyed when Ubisoft surprisingly added Steam achievements to Assassin's Creed Unity in an update, a decade after its release.

The reasoning behind this increase seems pretty clear. Assassin's Creed Unity is currently available for $4.49 on Steam at 85% off its full price, matching its all-time lowest price on the platform. Between 2020 and 2024, it fell to $4.49 numerous times on Steam, and it tends to be during this time that it enjoys its highest player count peaks. The game is certainly no stranger to random player count spikes - just a year ago, Assassin's Creed Unity tripled its player count after interest was boosted thanks to the Paris Olympics, the city in which the game takes place. No doubt, it won't be the last time this happens.

Over a decade after Assassin's Creed Unity 's launch, and the franchise is still a pillar of Ubisoft's success. The most recent game in the series, Assassin's Creed Shadows , was a much-needed success for the company, and it seems like Ubisoft only plans to lean further into its flagship franchise. A rumor earlier this year suggests that the plan is to release nine Assassin's Creed games over the next six years, which feels like a high-risk, high-reward strategy for Ubisoft. It remains to be seen if this will come to fruition.

item.title: Borderlands 4: How to Enable Frame Generation on All GPUs
item.description:
Borderlands 4 has been suffering from performance issues on a variety of PC hardware, whether it's a mid-range system or a high-end one. Some of the major uplift in performance comes from enabling the Frame Generation feature on Nvidia, AMD, and other GPUs, which is unfortunately greyed out for many players. Whether it's a bug or an intentional barrier, this guide will help you fix this issue with a few workarounds so you can enjoy Borderlands 4 at maximum FPS.

How to Fix "Frame Generation Greyed Out" Issue for Borderlands 4

Frame Generation is a feature that drastically boosts performance by predicting multiple frames ahead of time, which smooths out the gameplay and increases FPS. Due to the unoptimized nature of Borderlands 4 , this feature is a must-have if players want to experience the fast-paced action of the game without lag. However, the feature is currently greyed out for players who want to use the AMD FSR Frame Generation variant, instead of the Nvidia DLSS one.

Here's a workaround for players to fix the "Frame Generation greyed out" issue and enable FSR Frame Generation on all GPUs.

  1. Head to the Start Menu and enter the settings. Alternatively, you can choose to search for settings to access them.
  2. In settings, head into the Display settings, and then into the Graphics option.
  3. Expand the Advanced Graphics Settings tab and turn off Hardware-Accelerated GPU Scheduling.
  4. Once it's done, restart your PC for the changes to take effect.

After performing the workaround mentioned above, players will be able to activate the Frame Generation option after switching the in-game upscaling option to FSR in Borderlands 4 .

Doing the workaround above will instead grey out the DLSS Frame Generation option.

How to Enable DLSS Frame Generation on Older Nvidia GPUs (DLSS Enabler)

The DLSS Frame Generation feature is limited only to users of Nvidia RTX 40 series or higher GPUs. However, players can use a third-party tool called DLSS Enabler to turn on DLSS Frame Generation for older Nvidia GPUs, even possibly for other AMD GPUs.

Here's how to install DLSS Enabler for Borderlands 4 .

  1. Visit the official GitHub repository for DLSS Enabler and download the .exe file under the latest release.
  2. Open up the downloaded installer, and choose the Borderlands 4 install directory as DLSS Enabler's install target. Players can find the exact directory by heading into Steam > right-click Borderlands 4 > hover over Manage > click on the Browse Local Files option.
  3. In the Components section, select the options depending on your GPU (reference the image provided above).
  4. Go ahead and install.

Now all the files for DLSS Enabler will be placed inside the Borderlands 4 install directory. Now, all you need to do is launch the game, switch to DLSS in upscaler options, and turn on DLSS Frame Generation. This will help the majority of players enjoy the game at high frame rates.

To further optimize the game's performance, feel free to check out our Borderlands 4's best settings guide for PC.

item.title: New Borderlands 4 Shift Codes Get You Golden Keys
item.description:
Gearbox CEO Randy Pitchford has released two brand-new Borderlands 4 SHiFT codes, offering players a Golden Key each in the new game. Players can take advantage of these Borderlands 4 SHiFT codes for a limited time to get rare loot opening Golden Chests.

SHiFT codes are a system featured across the Borderlands games as a way for Gearbox to reward players with in-game keys, which can then be exchanged to open chests and get rare loot for free. They can also unlock new cosmetics, however, this is much rarer. As Borderlands titles get older, Gearbox often becomes a lot more generous with SHiFT codes - just a few weeks back, one code had 70 keys for grabs across various Borderlands titles. However, with Borderlands 4 only releasing a few days ago, it makes sense that the developer doesn't want to just hand all the loot to players for free.

New Borderlands 4 SHiFT Codes Offer One Golden Key Each

In a post on X, Gearbox CEO Randy Pitchford decided to "test the SHiFT code system for Golden Keys in Borderlands 4 " by handing out two new ones on the platform. These are B9XT3-HX6TT-W6BBW-TTJT3-JTFKX and 39RTT-3ZR3T-5FJBK-3J3J3-C5CRT , each rewarding one Golden Key each. They can be entered on any linked account over on the SHiFT website right now.

  • B9XT3-HX6TT-W6BBW-TTJT3-JTFKX
  • 39RTT-3ZR3T-5FJBK-3J3J3-C5CRT

Players wanting to use the latest Borderlands 4 SHiFT codes need to act fast. According to Pitchford, the codes will expire on September 16, after which they'll be gone for good. There will definitely be even more SHiFT codes in the future, but at this early stage, these Golden Keys could be particularly important for players getting some awesome loot to help them complete their first playthrough of the game.

The response to Borderlands 4 has been largely positive from critics, with a current Top Critic Average of 85 on review aggregator site OpenCritic. While concerns over the game's PC performance remain, Gearbox has already released a patch for Borderlands 4 aimed squarely at addressing this. Hopefully, this is just the tip of the iceberg, and Gearbox continues to work at smoothing out the experience for players.
